Package Pacman

Class Level

  • java.lang.Object
    • Pacman.Level
  • public class Level
extends java.lang.Object
    The class Level represents the board game with all the entities such as Pacman, ghosts, Cases and bonuses This class holds the "main" method, to allow the player to play the game It computes each frame, to move the entities according to the keyboard inputs
    Author:
    Nicolas FONNIER, Henri GLEVEAU

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Level()
      Level constructor, no params needed

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void changeList()
      Loads the file that contains the level corresponding to the index
      int checkEndGame()
      Check all the end game cases, which are: Pacman has no lives left, there are no bonuses left
      void computeNextFrame()
      Checks the ending scenarios with checkEndGame(), calls endGame(int) if 1 or 2.
      void drawList()
      Runs through the list and draws each square.
      void drawModifiedList()
      Draws the list of all the Drawable objects that have been modified between two calls of computeNextFrame().
      void endGame​(int endState)
      Handles the different ending scenarios
      static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      Point of entry
      void resetGhost()
      Resets all the ghost to their starting positions according to what has been found in changeList()
      void updateGhost()
      Updates the ghost object according to a random number and checks for collision with walls.
      void updatePacMan()
      Updates the Pacman object according to the input and checks for collision with walls, ghost, and bonuses, and then react accordingly.
      void writeScore()
      Fetches the score from pacman, and writes it to scores.dat

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Level

        public Level()
        Level constructor, no params needed

    • Method Detail

      • drawList

        public void drawList()
        Runs through the list and draws each square. Draws, in order: Squares, bonus, ghost, Pacman

      • drawModifiedList

        public void drawModifiedList()
        Draws the list of all the Drawable objects that have been modified between two calls of computeNextFrame().

      • changeList

        public void changeList()
        Loads the file that contains the level corresponding to the index

      • computeNextFrame

        public void computeNextFrame()
        Checks the ending scenarios with checkEndGame(), calls endGame(int) if 1 or 2. If 0, calls successively updateGhost(), then updatePacMan(), then drawModifiedList(), then itself again.

      • updateGhost

        public void updateGhost()
        Updates the ghost object according to a random number and checks for collision with walls. It also manages to update the location of ghosts

      • resetGhost

        public void resetGhost()
        Resets all the ghost to their starting positions according to what has been found in changeList()

      • updatePacMan

        public void updatePacMan()
        Updates the Pacman object according to the input and checks for collision with walls, ghost, and bonuses, and then react accordingly.

      • checkEndGame

        public int checkEndGame()
        Check all the end game cases, which are: Pacman has no lives left, there are no bonuses left
        Returns:
        0 if everything's fine, 1 if Pacman has no more lives, 2 if there are no more bonuses

      • endGame

        public void endGame​(int endState)
        Handles the different ending scenarios
        Parameters:
        endState - The state that has been detected. Cf checkEndGame()

      • writeScore

        public void writeScore()
        Fetches the score from pacman, and writes it to scores.dat

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        Point of entry
        Parameters:
        args - Automatically sent by the system when the program is called
